user.name: Shital Shah
user.description: Mostly research and code. If universe is an optimizer, what is its loss function? All opinions are my own.

fullText:
Since 1960s, assumption was that intelligence is due to possession of vast number of facts, patterns, heuristics. 

The Bitter Lesson is not to collect them manually. Instead let algos find them from data. Call it "scaling law".

Bitterest Lesson: that's not really intelligence.
